page.title: 02St Leonard's Church Bulford
page.content: St Leonard's church is one of our oldest buildings.The archway leading to the chancel and one lancet window in the chancel date back to 1265. In medieval times few people could read,so the church walls were decorated with pictures,traces of which remain.When Oliver Cromwell became ruler he ordered the plastering over of the pictures.In their place the Puritans had to write the words of God.A part of the Ten Commandments remains on the wall. The only stained glass windows date from 1918 and are a memorial to the Bulford men who died in World War 1. It is the only non Garrison church in Britain to be owned by the Ministry of Defence.
